interesting_fact: Argentina is home to the world’s southernmost city, Ushuaia, which is often referred to as ‘the end of the world’.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
China is the most populous country in the world and has more than 2000 years of continuous history.
France is known for its rich history and culture, and it is home to the Eiffel Tower, one of the most famous landmarks in the world.
Germany is home to the world’s first automobile, invented by Karl Benz in 1885.
India is the world’s largest democracy, and it is also home to the Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
Italy is famous for its art, cuisine, and history, and the city of Rome is home to the Vatican, the smallest independent country in the world.
Japan has over 6,800 islands and is home to Mount Fuji, one of the most iconic volcanoes in the world.
Mexico is known for its rich culture, and it is the birthplace of chocolate, chilies, and corn.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.
South Africa is the only country in the world to have hosted the FIFA World Cup, the Rugby World Cup, and the Cricket World Cup.
Spain is known for its siestas and flamenco music and dance, as well as its historic architecture like the Alhambra.
Sweden is known for its beautiful natural landscapes, and it has over 100,000 lakes.
The UK is famous for the monarchy, and London is one of the world’s leading financial centers.
The United States is the third-largest country by land area and is known for its diversity in culture, landscapes, and population.
Vietnam is famous for its cuisine, especially pho and spring rolls, and it has a rich history dating back thousands of years.
Egypt is home to the ancient pyramids, including the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, the holiest city in Islam, and it has the world’s largest oil reserves.
